block.p: Lou Cannon (Oct. 1) contrasts ''the sheer lack of public outcry'' in the Los Angeles Police Department's Rampart corruption scandal to the response to the 1992 riots. But the riots frightened the city's upscale communities, creating a specter of Molotov-cocktail-wielding mobs rampaging through Beverly Hills.

The Rampart scandal is in a working-class part of the city that more affluent citizens rarely visit. In 1992, you could clearly see the smoke drifting up from South Central toward Brentwood and Beverly Hills.
